image.title: The Standard Kenya
image.description: Standardmedia.co.ke We deliver breaking news from across Kenya and the globe and information on the latest top stories, business, sports and entertainment headlines. Follow the news as it happens through: special reports, videos, audio, photo gallerie and many more.

item.title: Elderly woman in Kisii demonstrations is mentally ill, family confirms
item.description: Rose is a frequent visitor to Kisii Central Police Station where she enjoys free meals from the police officer at the station's canteen.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Baby Sagini's eyes were gouged by close relatives, court rules
item.description: "Evidence adduced throughout show a consistent pattern of a child growing in an abusive environment where he was brutally denied basic rights to survival as should any normal child."
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Matatus, buses to be fitted with dashboard cameras to tame road carnage, says Murkomen
item.description: All commercial vehicles, school buses to be fitted with dashboard cameras and vehicle telematics in bid to avert accidents and monitor traffic, CS Murkomen says.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: President Ruto makes more appointments, revokes others
item.description: President William Ruto has made further appointments to the public sector and revoked some of the individuals appointed by retired President Uhuru Kenyatta.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: 41 bodies of the Londiani crash victims identified as mortuary struggles with high death toll
item.description: A total of 41 of the 53 bodies of victims of the Londiani junction traffic accident kept at the Kericho County Hospital mortuary have been identified.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Jaramogi's former aide elected Luo Council of Elders chairman
item.description: "I thank the elders for electing me. I will serve the community without any corruption," Randa said.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: School feeding program that made Governor Sakaja cry gets Sh1.2 billion in City budget
item.description: County Executive Committee for Finance Charles Kerich who delivered the budget said the school feeding program will encourage students to attend school leading to an increase in enrollment.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Ngong residents stage protests over poor road
item.description: The residents of Ngong say the political leadership in the area has neglected their responsibility to tarmac Maasai-Silanga road, despite the road being earmarked for tarmacking.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Bungoma Chief arrested for demanding bribe 'falls ill' before arraignment
item.description: After arriving at the court premises, Murutu fell ill and was unable to alight from the vehicle for transfer to the court cell before taking a plea.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Politician's lawyer locked out of a property demolition case
item.description: Justice Mogeni declined to adjourn after finding that Ochola had enough time to hire a new lawyer and regularise the same before yesterday's hearing.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Crack whip at NHIF, Governor Barasa urges President Ruto
item.description: "I want to call on the president to take stern action on perpetrators of mismanagement of health public funds. I know we are pumping a lot of money to the NHIF," Barasa said.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Livestream platform eyes content creators
item.description: According to Kinyanjui, the platform will be a disruptor in the market that is already flooded with likes of Instagram, Tiktok, Spotify, Facebook and YouTube among others.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Kajiado woman allegedly kills her two children
item.description: After they put out the fire that is when they discovered the bodies of the two children aged two and eight, burnt beyond recognition.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Stakeholders call for combined efforts in fighting for children's rights
item.description: They marched to and from the Marich World Vision offices to the Sigor Junction carrying banners as they sang songs of protecting the African child from any form of humiliation.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Kakamega's Barasa signs Sh17.6b budget appropriation bill to law
item.description: Barasa revealed that the maiden budget has surpassed the required 30 per cent threshold for development which is at 36 per cent.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Jekim Hospital Nkubu, Meru reopens after court order
item.description: Court allows Meru-based Jekim Hospital to reopen days after Health CS Susan Nakhumicha ordered its shut down on NHIF fraud allegations.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Midnight attack leaves five dead in Lamu West, police say
item.description: Five people died on Sunday in Salama village, Lamu West, after unknown assailants attacked their homes at midnight.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Death toll in Migaa road accident hits five as two succumb to injuries
item.description: Five people have been confirmed dead after they were involved in a grisly road accident at Migaa, along the Nakuru-Eldoret Highway.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Arror and Kimwarer dams construction to resume, Gachagua says
item.description: "Arror and Kimwarer dams were canceled because of retrogressive politics. They wanted to stop government projects in President Ruto's backyard and use it to make him unpopular," Gachagua said.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Residents eject surveyors from Delmonte land
item.description: The residents blocked the county government officials from accessing the land by barricading the road with stones and logs.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Westlands MP urges Governor Sakaja to protect small business against harassment
item.description: Westlands MP Tim Wanyonyi want Nairobi Governor Johnson Sakaja to safeguard small businesses from unwarranted harassment by county authorities.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Machakos budget: Health, Agriculture and Infrastructure top Machakos spending
item.description: Machakos County will spend huge resources to finance Health, Agriculture and Infrastructure programs in the 2023/24 financial year.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Kakamega Governor Fernades Barasa roots for partnerships to improve sanitation in learning institutions
item.description: Schools in Kakamega County will now be supplied with purification machines in a quest to reduce the consumption of unsafe water.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: President Ruto's mother covers journalist with Shuka over short dress
item.description: She said she blessed the lady with the shuka as an act of love pleading with her not to be angry over her actions.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Pathologists conduct 22 autopsies on Shakahola victims
item.description: "We have realized that most victims of the third phase of autopsies are children," said Oduor.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Urgently hear our 25,000 acre land case, Mark Too's family ask Supreme Court
item.description: The dispute dates back to 2012 when Sirikwa Squatters Group sued the late Too's company Fanikiwa Limited for illegally taking over their land.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Inside Simba Arati Sh13.8 billion Budget
item.description: In the estimates, Governor Simba Arati has been allocated Sh538 million for his office operations.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Garissa University smarts from terror attack, conduct graduations
item.description: Local leaders raised concerns over the mass exodus of teachers from the region under the pretext of security.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: Sakaja school feeding program to face court action
item.description: Education Rights Specialist Muthoni Ouko said there are more needy children in non-formal schools in Nairobi than there are in public primary schools.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital

item.title: EALA MP Sankok on fire over 'Lovers Nest' sexist remark
item.description: The women from different groups in the country are requesting the legistrator to apologize for the remarks he allegedly made while marketing his Narok resort.
item.dc:creator: Standard Digital
